thread.title: Brandon Regional Hospital takes wraps off bigger ER
thread.title_full: Brandon Regional Hospital takes wraps off bigger ER

author: Margie Manning
title: Brandon Regional Hospital takes wraps off bigger ER
text: 7 photos The Brandon Regional Hospital emergency department is one of the busiest in Florida,… more Brandon Regional Hospital has completed a key part of a $60 million expansion project — construction of an expanded emergency department. The expanded department includes eight new exam rooms, four new trauma rooms, an ambulance entrance and a helipad. Patients can also receive procedures in the department, a move that will help ensure faster care, a spokesman said. 7 photos The Brandon Regional Hospital emergency department is one of the busiest in Florida,… more It's one of several ongoing or recently completed hospital expansions in the Tampa Bay area, as health care facilities tap into an expanding population with a healthy mix of government, commercial insurance and private payers. Available credit has made financing the projects attractive, Eric Obeck , senior regional president for Hancock Bank (NASDAQ: HBHC), told Tampa Bay Business Journal last year . Brandon Regional, which is owned by HCA Holdings (NYSE: HCA) and is part of HCA West Florida, treats an average of more than 120,000 emergency patients each year, according to data from the Florida Agency for Health Care Administration. “As one of the busiest emergency departments in Florida, we are always seeking new ways to treat patients more efficiently while maintaining our high quality of care,” Bland Eng , Brandon Regional Hospital CEO, said in a press release. “Expanding our space improves the patient experience and allows us to better serve our community.” The hospital began a $60 million expansion in early 2014 , one of the biggest expansions in HCA West Florida’s history. The final phase of the hospital’s expansion will include a 16-room pediatric emergency department, slated for completion in November. Brandon Regional Hospital, at 119 Oakfield Dr. in Brandon, is a 398-bed acute care facility with a 25-bed behavioral health center and other centers focused on women’s health, heart and vascular conditions, and reflux. Margie Manning is Finance Editor of the   She covers the Money beat. Florida hospital ED visits 2015 Hospital, city
